title: How to Make Cookie Taco Shells

steps.headline: Vegetable-spray a cookie sheet.
steps.description: Cover with parchment paper and respray.

steps.headline: Mix the flour and cinnamon in small bowl.
Mix the egg white, sugar, butter, canola oil and the vanilla extract in another small bowl.
Mix until smooth and sugar has dissolved.
Mix dry ingredients in with wet mixture.
Mix again.
steps.description: You'll want a cinnamon color now.

steps.headline: Get a little less than a tablespoon of batter.
Pour onto the cookie sheet.
steps.description: Spread the circles fairly far apart.

steps.headline: Spread circles.
steps.description: Use the back of a spoon to make them about four inches in diameter.

steps.headline: Take a quick measure if needed.
steps.description: Having circles the wrong size will result in either burnt or under-cooked taco cookies.

steps.headline: Place wooden spatulas, spoons, or forks over Tupperware container.
steps.description: Later this will be your drying rack.

steps.headline: Bake in pre-heated oven at 325ºF/170ºC for 7-9 minutes.
steps.description: Bake one sheet at a time. You'll want a golden brown around the edges.

text: Vegetable-spray a cookie sheet. Cover with parchment paper and respray. Mix the flour and cinnamon in small bowl.  Mix the egg white, sugar, butter, canola oil and the vanilla extract in another small bowl.  Mix until smooth and sugar has dissolved.  Mix dry ingredients in with wet mixture.  Mix again. You'll want a cinnamon color now. Get a little less than a tablespoon of batter. This is also called a 'scant'. Pour onto the cookie sheet. Spread the circles fairly far apart. Spread circles. Use the back of a spoon to make them about four inches in diameter. Take a quick measure if needed. Having circles the wrong size will result in either burnt or under-cooked taco cookies. Place wooden spatulas, spoons, or forks over Tupperware container. Later this will be your drying rack. Bake in pre-heated oven at 325ºF/170ºC for 7-9 minutes. Bake one sheet at a time. You'll want a golden brown around the edges. Remove tacos from cookie sheet.  Drape cookies over spoons. Allow them to cool completely. Keep in an airtight container.
